Package com.foreach.across.modules.entity.bind

Class EntityPropertiesBinder

java.lang.Object
java.util.AbstractMap<K,V>
java.util.HashMap<String,EntityPropertyBinder>
com.foreach.across.modules.entity.bind.EntityPropertiesBinder
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Cloneable, Map<String,EntityPropertyBinder>
public class EntityPropertiesBinder extends HashMap<String,EntityPropertyBinder>
Wrapper for binding values to custom properties. Much like a BeanWrapper except it uses an EntityPropertyRegistry to determine which properties exist and what their type is. Each existing descriptor should have a EntityPropertyController with a value reader/writer for correct use.

Implemented as a Map for data binder purposes, but expects every key to correspond with a registered property in the EntityPropertyRegistry. When fetched, will create an intermediate target for that property and apply type conversion based on the registered property type. Should not be used as a regular Map implementation.

When a ConversionService is specified, type conversion will occur when setting a property value.

WARNING: The current implementation has some limitations. Especially the fact that a single EntityPropertiesBinder is strongly attached to a single entity or target. You cannot use the same binder and apply its values to multiple targets. Resetting the binder is done manually by calling clear(), or automatically by updating either setEntity(Object) or setTarget(Object).

Since:
3.2.0
Author:
Arne Vandamme
See Also:

  • Method Details

    • setEntity

      public void setEntity(Object entity)
      The original entity that this binder is attached to. If only an entity but no target set, this binder will behave as readonly.

      WARNING: Updating the entity will reset the entire binder as if for a new instance.

    • setTarget

      public void setTarget(Object target)
      The target for binding. If not set values can be fetched but binding-related controller methods will fail: applying values, validating and saving.

      WARNING: Updating the target will reset the entire binder as if for a new instance.

    • getProperties

      public final EntityPropertiesBinder getProperties()
      Returns self so that this binder could be used as direct DataBinder target. The setBinderPrefix(String) is usually set to properties in this case.
      Returns:
      self

    • asBindingContext

      public final EntityPropertyBindingContext asBindingContext()
      Returns:
      a EntityPropertyBindingContext representing the target of this binder with changes applied

      public EntityPropertyBinder get(Object key)
      Get the property with the given name. Will fetch the property descriptor and create the value holder with the current value. If there is no descriptor for that property, an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.
      Specified by:

    • get

      public EntityPropertyBinder get(@NonNull @NonNull EntityPropertyDescriptor descriptor)
      Get the property binder for the descriptor. This will automatically register the binder.
      Parameters:
      descriptor - property descriptor
      Returns:
      property binder

    • setBindingEnabled

      public void setBindingEnabled(boolean bindingEnabled)
      Signal that actual binding is enabled, this allows individual property binders to determine how they should interpret the current value. For example: if binding is enabled and a list value is requested, the list will only return the items that have been bound before, disregarding the currently stored value.

      In readonly mode this property will usually be kept false, simply returning the property values.

      Parameters:
      bindingEnabled - true to signal binding is enabled

    • createController

      public EntityPropertiesBinderController createController()
      Create a new controller for this properties binder, allows for applying, validating and saving the configured binder properties.
      Returns:
      new controller instance

      public boolean isReadonly()
      Returns:

    • setBinderPrefix

      public void setBinderPrefix(String binderPrefix)
      Prefix when the map is being used for data binding. If set and an exception occurs when setting a property value, it will be rethrown as a ConversionNotSupportedException with PropertyChangeEvent information.

      The binder prefix would usually be the name of a property where this EntityPropertiesBinder is available on the DataBinder target. When using

    • getBinderPrefix

      public String getBinderPrefix()
      Prefix when the map is being used for data binding. If set and an exception occurs when setting a property value, it will be rethrown as a ConversionNotSupportedException with PropertyChangeEvent information.

      The binder prefix would usually be the name of a property where this EntityPropertiesBinder is available on the DataBinder target. When using

    • setTemplateValueResolver

      public void setTemplateValueResolver(@NonNull @NonNull EntityPropertyTemplateValueResolver templateValueResolver)
      The resolver that should be used for determining template values of properties: list item and map entry templates.

    • getTemplateValueResolver

      @NonNull public @NonNull EntityPropertyTemplateValueResolver getTemplateValueResolver()
      The resolver that should be used for determining template values of properties: list item and map entry templates.

    • setConversionService

      public void setConversionService(org.springframework.core.convert.ConversionService conversionService)
      Optionally set a ConversionService that should be used to convert the input value to the required field type. It no ConversionService is set, the actual value must match the expected field type or a ClassCastException will occur.

      If a ConversionService is set, type conversion will be attempted and exceptions will only be thrown if conversion failes.

    • isBindingEnabled

      public boolean isBindingEnabled()
